Title: Lagos tasks clerics  with ending stigma,  discrimination against persons living with HIV
Summary: Lagos State government, yesterday, reaffirmed its commitment to ending HIV-related stigma and discrimination . It implored religious leaders to use their platforms to promote HIV awareness and encourage voluntary testing .

Title: Don urges govt to prioritise community policing
Summary: Don urges govt to prioritise community policing and intelligence . Country Director, GOALPrime Organisation Nigeria, Prof. Christopher Chinedumuije urges President Bola Tinubu to strengthen community policing .

Title: Kanu writes Trump, seeks probe into alleged killings in S’East
Summary: The detained leader of the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB), Nnamdi Kanu, has written to the United States President, Donald Trump, urging him to initiate an independent investigation . Kanu writes Trump, seeks probe into alleged killings in S’East .

Title: Sanwo-Olu, Oteh lead call for women empowerment, inclusion at WIMBIZ 2025
Summary: Lagos State Governor, Babajide Sanwo-Olu, reaffirmed his administration’s commitment to empowering women through leadership, equity, and inclusion, which are pillars he described as critical to sustainable progress .

Title: NMA backs resident doctors as strike enters day seven in 91 hospitals
Summary: Nigerian Medical Association (NMA), Lagos State branch, has announced its support for the ongoing nationwide strike by the Nigerian Association of Resident Doctors (NARD) as action entered its seventh day .

Title: Edun assumes G-24 chairmanship
Summary: Minister of Finance and Coordinating Minister of the Economy, Mr. Wale Edun, formally assumed the Chairmanship of the G-24 . Edun announced that the group will focus on “Optimising Resource Development for Inclusive, Job-Rich Economic Transformation” under his leadership .

Title: Israel, Nigeria to deepen dialogue on peace, economic cooperation — Envoy
Summary: The Israeli Ambassador to Nigeria, Mr Michael Freeman, underscored the need to deepen Israel-Nigeria dialogue on peace building and economic cooperation . Freeman made this known at a programme titled “Co-existence and Dialogue among Abrahamic Faiths,” held on Thursday in Abuja .

Title: Anambra Showdown 2025: Candidates’ fate now in the hands of voters
Summary: 2.8 million eligible voters head to the polls today, November 8 . The incumbent governor, Professor Chukwuma Soludo, visited nearly all the state’s 179 communities . Many other candidates focused mainly on consultations with selected stakeholders .

Title: IFAD tasks Nigerian govts on investment in agriculture for youth empowerment
Summary: IFAD calls on Nigerian govts to invest more in agriculture not just to ensure food security but also to harness the potentials of the youths . The Country Director of IFAD, Mrs Dede Ekoue stated this yesterday in Nigeria .

Title: Shettima tasks global leaders on reasonable action against climate change at COP 30
Summary: Vice-President Kashim Shettima made the call at the opening of the Heads of State Summit at the 30th UN Climate Change Conference (COP 30), on Thursday in Belém, Brazil . He also implored world leaders to be ‘reasonable action’ and moving from pledges to performance in tackling climate change .
